title.narrative: Upgrading shelter conditions for 140 female-headed household and provision of inclusive education services for 2180 Palestine Refugee students

description.narrative:
The project aims to achieve the following expected results in the five areas of intervention (North, Saida, Tyre, Beqaa, and Central Lebanon): 1)Shelter conditions are improved for 140 female-headed households and households with at least one person with special needs (PSN) member;2)2,170 children reached by the intensive support program of the Learning Support team, in the current academic year 2019-2020: 993 Grade 1 (131 PRS and 862 PRL) and 1,177 Grade 2 (178 PRS and 999 PRL);3)10 SEN children (between the age 6-18) enrolled in Special Education schooling.
The project targets a total of 2,180 vulnerable Palestinian refugees from Syria and Palestinian refugees in Lebanon with Education engagement and 588 of the same vulnerable populations of concern with ES/NFI engagement.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Relief and Works Agency

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS LEBANON UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Children with Special Education Needs (SEN) have access to Special Education
# of SEN children (age 6-18) with severe learning difficulties attending Special Education
% of SEN children (age 6-18) with severe learning difficulties completing Special Education
Grade 1 and Grade 2 children have access to UNRWA’s intensive Learning Support programme at school Education - Education
Cumulative drop-out rate to the end of elementary education decreased
Passing rate at final scholastic exam in the subject matters (Arabic, Maths and English) of students in lower elementary grade 1 and grade 2 targeted by the LSP intensive support
Living conditions for approximately 140 of the most vulnerable female-headed Palestine refugee households with at least one member with specific needs in camps improved
Number of female-headed households contributing to the design of their shelters
Percentage of Palestine refugee beneficiaries reporting satisfaction with the project’s contribution to their living conditions
